intro: Lepidium rahmeri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and alpine environments, thriving at high elevations. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the summer months. Lepidium rahmeri is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and tiny, edible seeds that are often used by local wildlife.
